p: The current study of Etsassala et al. [ 146] applied a fast screening method using a cyclic voltammetry technique for evaluating anti-tyrosinase activity of twenty-five species of plants from the Lamiaceae family: among these, those that showed a fast current inhibition rate at a minimum concentration when compared to a kojic acid standard were classified as having the greatest anti-tyrosinase activity such as Salvia chamelaeagnea, S. dolomitica, Plectranthus ecklonii, P. namaensis, and P. zuluensis.
